sanskrit_verse: अपदिश्यापदेश्यं च पुनर्यस्त्वपधावति । अपदिश्यापदेशं सम्यक्प्रणिहितं चार्थं पृष्टः सन्नाभिनन्दति ॥ ८.५४॥
transliteration: apadiśyāpadeśyaṃ ca punaryastvapadhāvati | apadiśyāpadeśaṃ samyakpraṇihitaṃ cārthaṃ pṛṣṭaḥ sannābhinandati || 8.54||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who, having previously rejected or opposed a teaching, subsequently pursues it again, and when questioned, approves of that same teaching rightly directed toward purpose—such a being demonstrates conscious realignment through behavioral reversal.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in the capacity for conscious recognition and reaffirmation of truth
Causation flows from internal cognitive shift rather than external compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility is measured by volitional return to alignment
Restoration logic operates through acknowledgment and re-embrace of dharma
Consciousness alignment manifests via active affirmation after prior rejection
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent previously rejected dharma THEN subsequent acceptance invalidates prior misalignment status
IF questioned about prior opposition AND agent affirms corrected understanding THEN restore participation rights
WHEN behavior reverses without coercion THEN assign positive recognition over punitive consequence
IF agent demonstrates cognitive reorientation THEN initiate integration protocol而非remediation process
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this principle establishes that repeated engagement with dharma after explicit denial indicates evolved capacity. The threshold of responsibility shifts from past error to present cognition. Authority recognizes such reversal as valid grounds for legal reintegration, bypassing punitive frameworks.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals causal sequence: initial aversion → experiential maturation → renewed acceptance. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms natural unfolding of consciousness. Responsibility aligns proportionally with current cognition, not historical deviation. Non-punitive reality rule ensures justice serves evolution, not vengeance.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to acknowledge full cycle of rejection and return
Assign responsibility assumption protocol wherein individual publicly reaffirms alignment
Activate integrity reintegration mechanism allowing social and legal reinstatement
Deploy capacity restoration framework confirming readiness for renewed participation
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Justice executed not as punishment but as consciousness-aligned restoration. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
